canonical_explanation.text: A circle is a closed curve where all points are at the same distance from a fixed point called the centre. The radius is the distance from the centre to any point on the circle. The diameter is a line segment passing through the centre connecting two points on the circle. Diameter = 2 × Radius. A chord is a line segment joining any two points on the circle. The diameter is the longest chord. The circumference is the distance around the circle.
rules: Centre: the fixed point in the middle of the circle
Radius: distance from centre to any point on the circle
Diameter: line segment through the centre from one side to the other
Chord: a line segment joining two points on the circle
The diameter is the longest chord of a circle
Circumference: the perimeter (distance around) of a circle
All radii of a circle are equal

questions.question_text: The fixed point in the middle of a circle is called the:
questions.explanation_correct: The centre is the fixed point from which all points on the circle are at equal distance.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The fixed middle point of a circle is called its centre.

questions.question_text: The distance from the centre to any point on the circle is called the:
questions.explanation_correct: The radius is the distance from the centre of the circle to any point on the circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Radius = distance from centre to a point on the circle.

questions.question_text: A line segment that passes through the centre and has both endpoints on the circle is called the:
questions.explanation_correct: The diameter is a line segment through the centre connecting two points on the circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A diameter passes through the centre and touches both sides of the circle.

questions.question_text: A line segment joining any two points on a circle is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A chord is any line segment whose endpoints lie on the circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A chord connects two points on the circle. It may or may not pass through the centre.

questions.question_text: The diameter is a chord of the circle.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the diameter joins two points on the circle (through the centre), so it is a special chord — the longest chord.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A diameter is a chord that passes through the centre. It is the longest possible chord.

questions.question_text: If the radius of a circle is 5 cm, its diameter is:
questions.explanation_correct: Diameter = 2 × Radius = 2 × 5 = 10 cm.

questions.question_text: If the diameter of a circle is 14 cm, its radius is:
questions.explanation_correct: Radius = Diameter ÷ 2 = 14 ÷ 2 = 7 cm.

questions.question_text: The diameter is always ___ the radius.
questions.explanation_correct: Diameter = 2 × Radius, so the diameter is always double (twice) the radius.
questions.explanation_incorrect: D = 2R. The diameter is always twice the radius.

questions.question_text: A circular bangle has a diameter of 8 cm. Its radius is:
questions.explanation_correct: Radius = Diameter ÷ 2 = 8 ÷ 2 = 4 cm.

questions.question_text: Ananya drew a circle with radius 6 cm. What is the length of its longest chord?
questions.explanation_correct: The longest chord is the diameter. Diameter = 2 × 6 = 12 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The longest chord = diameter = 2 × radius = 2 × 6 = 12 cm.

questions.question_text: All radii of a circle are equal in length.
questions.explanation_correct: Every point on the circle is at the same distance from the centre, so all radii are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Since all points on the circle are equidistant from the centre, every radius has the same length.

questions.question_text: All chords of a circle are equal in length.
questions.explanation_correct: Chords can have different lengths. Only the diameter is the longest chord. Chords closer to the centre are longer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chords vary in length. The diameter is the longest chord.

questions.question_text: How many diameters can a circle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has infinitely many diameters, each passing through the centre in a different direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You can draw a diameter in any direction through the centre, so there are infinitely many.

questions.question_text: Which of these is always true for a chord?

options.text: It is equal to the diameter
Its endpoints lie on the circle
It is longer than the radius

questions.explanation_correct: By definition, a chord is a line segment with both endpoints on the circle. It may or may not pass through the centre.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A chord's endpoints must be on the circle. Only a special chord (diameter) passes through the centre.

questions.question_text: The distance around a circle is called its:
questions.explanation_correct: The circumference is the distance around (perimeter of) a circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The circumference is the total length of the boundary of a circle.

questions.question_text: Circumference of a circle is similar to the ___ of a rectangle.
questions.explanation_correct: Circumference is the perimeter (boundary length) of a circle, just as perimeter is the boundary length of a rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Circumference = perimeter of a circle (distance around the boundary).

questions.question_text: Rahul has a circular plate with radius 9 cm. What is the diameter of the plate?
questions.explanation_correct: Diameter = 2 × Radius = 2 × 9 = 18 cm.

questions.question_text: A circular clock has a diameter of 30 cm. The distance from the centre to the edge is:
questions.explanation_correct: Distance from centre to edge = radius = diameter ÷ 2 = 30 ÷ 2 = 15 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Radius = D ÷ 2 = 30 ÷ 2 = 15 cm.

questions.question_text: Which part of a circle is longest?
questions.explanation_correct: The diameter is the longest chord (line segment) within a circle. (The circumference is longer, but it is a curve, not a segment.)
questions.explanation_incorrect: The diameter is the longest straight line segment that fits inside a circle.

questions.question_text: If the diameter of a circle is 20 cm, the radius is ___ cm.
questions.explanation_correct: Radius = Diameter ÷ 2 = 20 ÷ 2 = 10 cm.

questions.question_text: Which instrument is used to draw a circle?
questions.explanation_correct: A compass is the instrument used to draw circles with a given radius.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A compass (with a pointed end and a pencil end) is used to draw circles.

questions.question_text: To draw a circle with radius 4 cm using a compass, you should set the compass opening to:
questions.explanation_correct: The compass opening (distance between the pointed end and pencil) equals the radius. So set it to 4 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compass opening = radius of the circle = 4 cm.

questions.question_text: If you want a circle with diameter 10 cm, the compass opening should be:
questions.explanation_correct: Compass opening = radius = diameter ÷ 2 = 10 ÷ 2 = 5 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compass is set to radius. Radius = 10 ÷ 2 = 5 cm.

questions.question_text: The circumference of a circle is always greater than its diameter.
questions.explanation_correct: The circumference is more than 3 times the diameter (approximately 3.14 × diameter), so it is always greater.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Circumference ≈ 3.14 × diameter, which is always greater than the diameter.

questions.question_text: A wheel is in the shape of a:
questions.explanation_correct: A wheel is circular in shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wheels are round — they are circles.

questions.question_text: Two circles have radii 3 cm and 5 cm. The difference in their diameters is:
questions.explanation_correct: Diameters: 2 × 3 = 6 cm and 2 × 5 = 10 cm. Difference = 10 − 6 = 4 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: D1 = 6 cm, D2 = 10 cm. Difference = 10 − 6 = 4 cm.

questions.question_text: A chord that does NOT pass through the centre is always:
questions.explanation_correct: The diameter is the longest chord. Any other chord is shorter than the diameter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only the diameter (through the centre) is the longest chord. All other chords are shorter.

questions.question_text: The circumference of a circle is a straight line.
questions.explanation_correct: The circumference is a curved path around the circle, not a straight line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The circumference is the distance along the curved boundary of the circle.

questions.question_text: A coin has a radius of 1 cm. If 5 such coins are placed in a line touching each other, what is the total length?
questions.explanation_correct: Each coin has diameter = 2 × 1 = 2 cm. Five coins in a line: 5 × 2 = 10 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diameter per coin = 2 cm. Total = 5 × 2 = 10 cm.

questions.question_text: How many radii are needed to make one diameter?
questions.explanation_correct: A diameter is made up of two radii placed end to end through the centre.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diameter = radius + radius = 2 radii.

questions.question_text: The longest chord of a circle is the ___
questions.explanation_correct: The diameter, which passes through the centre, is the longest chord of any circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The diameter is the longest possible chord.

questions.question_text: A circular garden has a radius of 7 m. A straight path goes through the centre from one side to the other. The path length is:
questions.explanation_correct: The path through the centre = diameter = 2 × 7 = 14 m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Path through centre = diameter = 2 × radius = 2 × 7 = 14 m.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a part of a circle?
questions.explanation_correct: Diagonal is a term used for polygons (like rectangles, squares), not for circles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Circles have radius, diameter, chord, and circumference — not diagonals.

questions.question_text: If the radius of a wheel is doubled, the new diameter becomes:
questions.explanation_correct: If radius doubles from r to 2r, new diameter = 2 × 2r = 4r = 2 × (2r) = double the original diameter (2r).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Original D = 2r. New D = 2 × 2r = 4r = 2 × original D. The diameter also doubles.

questions.question_text: Priya wants to put a ribbon around a circular cake. The ribbon represents the:
questions.explanation_correct: A ribbon around the outside of a circle follows the circumference (the boundary).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Going around the circle = circumference.

questions.question_text: Can a chord be longer than the diameter?
questions.explanation_correct: The diameter is the longest chord of a circle. No chord can be longer than the diameter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The diameter is the maximum chord length. No chord exceeds it.

questions.question_text: Diameter = 2 × ___
questions.explanation_correct: The formula is Diameter = 2 × Radius.
questions.explanation_incorrect: D = 2 × R (diameter is twice the radius).

questions.question_text: A point on the circle is 8 cm from the centre. What is the radius?
questions.explanation_correct: The distance from the centre to any point on the circle IS the radius. So radius = 8 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: By definition, the distance from centre to any point on the circle = radius = 8 cm.

questions.question_text: Which is longer: the circumference of a circle or its diameter?
questions.explanation_correct: The circumference is always more than 3 times the diameter (C ≈ 3.14 × D), so it is much longer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Circumference ≈ 3.14 × diameter. The circumference is always longer.

questions.question_text: The radius of Circle A is 4 cm and the radius of Circle B is 6 cm. How much longer is Circle B's diameter?
questions.explanation_correct: Diameter A = 8 cm, Diameter B = 12 cm. Difference = 12 − 8 = 4 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: DA = 2 × 4 = 8 cm, DB = 2 × 6 = 12 cm. Difference = 4 cm.

questions.question_text: A diameter divides the circle into two equal halves.
questions.explanation_correct: A diameter passes through the centre and divides the circle into two equal semicircles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A diameter splits the circle into two equal semicircles.

questions.question_text: Half of a circle is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: Half a circle is a semicircle. 'Semi' means half.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Semi = half. Semicircle = half circle.

questions.question_text: A semicircular garden has a straight edge of 12 m. What is the radius of the full circle?
questions.explanation_correct: The straight edge of a semicircle is the diameter. Radius = Diameter ÷ 2 = 12 ÷ 2 = 6 m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Straight edge = diameter = 12 m. Radius = 12 ÷ 2 = 6 m.

questions.question_text: Identify a circular object in a classroom:
questions.explanation_correct: A wall clock is typically circular in shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A wall clock is round (circular). Books, blackboards, and doors are rectangular.

questions.question_text: The boundary of a circle is called its ___
questions.explanation_correct: The boundary (perimeter) of a circle is called its circumference.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The distance around a circle = circumference.

questions.question_text: Ravi drew a circle with a compass opening of 3.5 cm. What is the diameter of his circle?
questions.explanation_correct: Compass opening = radius = 3.5 cm. Diameter = 2 × 3.5 = 7 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compass opening = radius. Diameter = 2 × 3.5 = 7 cm.

questions.question_text: A chord always passes through the centre of the circle.
questions.explanation_correct: A chord joins two points on the circle but does not need to pass through the centre. Only the diameter passes through the centre.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only a diameter (a special chord) passes through the centre. Other chords do not.

questions.question_text: A circular pond has a diameter of 50 m. A fish swims from one edge directly to the centre. How far does it swim?
questions.explanation_correct: Edge to centre = radius = diameter ÷ 2 = 50 ÷ 2 = 25 m.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Radius = D ÷ 2 = 50 ÷ 2 = 25 m.

questions.question_text: How many chords can be drawn in a circle?
questions.explanation_correct: You can join any two points on the circle with a chord. Since there are infinitely many points, there are infinitely many chords.
questions.explanation_incorrect: There are unlimited points on a circle, so unlimited chords can be drawn.

questions.question_text: Which is the correct relationship?
questions.explanation_correct: The circumference is approximately 3.14 times the diameter, so it is always greater than the diameter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: C ≈ 3.14 × D. The circumference is always more than 3 times the diameter.
